Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: VAdesign
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights and found it extremely convenient and a great value for the price of London accommodations with en suite. Just a few minutes from the Earls Court tube station, it was well decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was a good size for a single room and the heated floors were a nice treat. On a not so positive note, the mattress was worn out, broadband internet didn't actually work with my computer as it is a new one, but I was able to connect to the wireless in the lobby, and the room was located next to the train tracks, but they stop running after midnight so it was never a problem. Overall, I found it very comfortable and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Aso V
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, the bathroom is 1x1 and the douche sprays on all sides, the furniture is demolished, the lamp keys are confusing. The hotel is totally overpriced!!! It has only good location, nothing more!!!

Reviews.Title: “thank you”
Reviews.Author: fabrikfamily
Reviews.Content: didnt know what to expect when i booked the room as had read some reviews which put me off!! still booked it though as seemed good value and good position. When we got there i was so plesently suprised staff were realy nice and the room was lovely!! nothing was too much trouble we were 1 minute away from the tube room was immacullatly clean breakfast was amazing all i can say is try this hotel as is the best value for money hotel i have ever stayed in london. i always believe you get for what you pay,but this was way above and beyond many thanks for a lovely relaxed couple of days we will see you again very soon x

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Decent value.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to catch a train to anywhere you desire- any airport and anywhere in the city. Room was TINY but I do understand that's often what you get so close to the city center. There was an iron and board, but really no place to use it. Bathroom was adequate with a nice deep bathtub. Great for soaking and to relax after a long day of sight seeing. Although, unless you wanted to soak the floor, taking a bath was really the only option. Tub/shower only had partial glass shield - covering less than a quarter of the tub length. Water, everywhere. All in all, good hotel and good location for the time spent in it. It was clean and nicely put together for the limited space. Afterall, we did not go to London to stay in the hotel the whole time. Did not partake in the English breakfast but there was a great coffee bakery sandwich shop (greggs) right around the corner across from the metro entrance.

Reviews.Title: “London City - Feb. 2012”
Reviews.Author: Roberto G
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for the 3 nights we spent in London. The room is a little small but it is in line with our expectations, enough clean and confortable. Very close to the Earl's Court underground station - well connected to Piccadilly line. So my personal overall rating is quite positive. Rgds, Roberto

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: roisin b
Reviews.Content: Seriously do not stay there. checked out this morning. found a half eaten fish cake and bagel under the bed. me and my boyfriend got conjunctivitis from the filthy pillows. room was tiny "superious deluxe" ya right. Staff bang around the hotel from half 7 on. Curtains dont close properly. the bathroom is tiny, with SEE THROUGH glass on the door!! skirting boards falling off, tvs dont work properly!! good location but bar that it is actually sick. wallpaper comin off the walls, no wonder it was so cheap. Hostel would have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: bild_11
Reviews.Content: We were arrived in this hotel at midnight and there is not room for us it is incredible, we were very tired and the call a taxi to went in other hotel. When i return at home with my surprise i note that they charged me 2 time the hotel room.the are thiefs i wait yet refund, I dont raccomand it . iT IS NOT AN HOTEL BUT HELL BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers does exsist.!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clare J
Reviews.Content: I booked a double superior deluxe via the net thinking what a good deal.We arrived to be taken to the lower ground floor where we found the underground was by our windows,there was only half a shower door,no light covers in the bathroom,curtains that didnt fit and god only knows what was on the carpert!!.The hotel was fully booked so had to spend the night with pillows in our ears.We were moved after speaking to the helpful manager.I explained and he offered 10% of our bill.The next room was the smallest box room with a double bed in.My girlfriend could turn on the tv with her foot from the bed it was that small.Our room that we were given was nice and comfortable and bigger.Very little tube noise.Only two members of staff were nice.The lady on the desk was mute and not helpful at all.Breakfast was gorgous,well worth staying just for that.Avoid at all costs because i came for a romantic break and we left totally knackered with tired eyes.We laugh about it as we feel we have stayed at Fawlty Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!”
Reviews.Author: Tomknight11
Reviews.Content: I checked in here for new years, on seeing the room was not impressed. Had a crack in the window and a socket was hanging off the wall so requested to be moved. Once moved was next to a train line and a chimney of some kind, so requested to be moved again and was meant to be a superior room, this room was tiny. One the cupboards with the iron in could hardly be opened, the entrance to the room was hard to get in, sockets were lose or hanging from wall, you couldn't get past one another in the room as was so small, the bathroom you could have one person in, so small you had to stand on the toilet to get in the shower. Again this room was next to the train line, but at this point I had given up as no one there really understood me (English was not spoken well) and no one was really helping. No at all impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected..avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Hopeful B
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Superior Deluxe Double" at the Kensington Townhouse via lastminute.com. When we arrived it was documented we had 2 double rooms booked, after explaining that I had in fact booked 1 "Superior Deluxe Double" they amended their details, saying something to do with the server had occured. The room we were offered was in no way "Superior" or "Deluxe", in fact although it was a Double room this purely accounted for the fact it had a double bed in the room, there was not really enough room for 2 people to move comfortably around the room without squeezing past each other. The room also looked out onto an old air con vent and the railway track .Each time a train went past (which was often) the whole room shook. I approached the hotel staff and they told me they were nearly fully booked but offered me a front facing room away from the track, however this room was even smaller and had a shower rather than the requested bath. Most of the staff were pleasant enough however the woman who greeted us did not smile the entire stay. The hotel information was on a scrappy piece of paper in a draw. There was an iron burn mark on the carpet and the bathroom tiles were cracked. The bathroom sink did not drain properly and the shower had no force at all! On our last day I was shocked to discover ants in the bathroom too! After a long journey we wanted to relax and enjoy our time away but sadly this wa not the case. I would rather stay in a travel lodge or premier in than return to the Kensington Townhouse!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferG123
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last night and can only describe it as terrible. I was meant to stay in the Shaftsbury Kensington across the road but they'd had 'server issues' and they were fully booked. They tried to move me to their sister hotel in Paddington but I had booked that hotel as I was attending a function near there so declined. They offered to put me in the Kensington Townhouse as it was just across the road but as it was only a 3 star offered me a 15% discount and a free breakfast. As i was already running late I said ok. Serious mistake! Several tiles on the bathroom floor was broken, the plug sockets were not fitted properly with gaps around them. The wallpaper was worn. There was no bottom valance on the bed. There were bugs crawling around the bed...I can only presume they were bed bugs! And the chairs and furniture were tatty and the room shook every time a tube went by, which was very frequently! After checking out and finding out that the 2 cans of soft drink I had ordered the previous night cost me the grand total of Â£4.30 I checked on the website to see how much the Kensington Townhouse was normally, I was disappointed to find out that I'd actually paid a little more than what you can normally book it for and that breakfast is always free. Not impressed whatsoever! Do not use this hotel...in fact I don't think i'd stay at a Best Western again as, from reading these reviews, they seem to move you to different hotels as and when they choose!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but it does the job required for the price”
Reviews.Author: tottyfod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now and will do again. Lots of negative reviews here so maybe I got lucky with my rooms? Last week I had a front-facing single room on 1st floor which had a little road noise but nothing too bad - there's not much traffic on Hogarth St. This week is was again a single room but at the back. yes there is regular tube noise but it is double-glazed - this is a city after all what can you expect them to do? Of course I have a 2 month old baby, so in comparison I don't find that tube noise bothers me, in fact I find it quite soothing. The rooms aren't huse and I only had shower cubicles in the bathroom, but they were clean and did the job. For the price, especially with breakfast included and the great location only 2mins from Earl's Court, I think it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dgledhillLondon
Reviews.Content: I just don't get the reviews of this hotel - I have stayed all over London as I work out of London 3 days a week sometimes and I think it is awesome - originally someone else booked this hotel for me because it was inexpensive - which worried me. Then I looked at the reviews and worried some more. When I arrived, the staff were fine, patchy english but that doesn't bother me in the slightest - the lift worried me - bit small but once I got to the room I was really surprised, I knew from the key card entry system that they must have invested in the hotel - the same card is then used to turn on the lighting which must also cost a fair bit. The room was really nicely decorated, dark oak panelling, floral curtains, white linen sheets - the bathroom was awesome and had a bath in it with designer lights and sink. Even the headrest is padded to the ceiling with ceiling spots that can be dimed for reading. A flat screen TV, at least 32" is in the room but only freeview channels. The only downside I think would be that not all the channels worked on the TV and you can hear the tube but this is LONDON afterall.... All in all, a really nice little hotel that is both inexpensive and central (only 2 mins from Earls Court Tube Station)

Reviews.Title: “no thanks”
Reviews.Author: ueno18
Reviews.Content: Bed bugs, cannot place one suitcase, internet never working, ridiculous bathroom Only positive point it is near Earls Court station!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!! AWFUL is too nice a word to use for this hell hole!”
Reviews.Author: LJnufc
Reviews.Content: Actually in my room just now, came to check in at 5:30, at 6:15 I was told my room was not ready I could wait in the restaurant across the road! Complained and got a complimentary meal worth Â£30. Have a 5 year old with me who just wants to go to sleep... Steak for me, ice cream for my little girl and if I'd been paying I would have wanted change out of 15 quid... It should have come to 27 pound...Terrible food.. Got to my room at 7:20 and guess what only BBC channels work, cable doesn't, maintenance guy tried but nope fuzzy picture on every other channel. Complained again, can't get me another room it's too late, they will try and fix it tomorrow.. The day I check out. My room smells of sewage and don't get me started on the trains passing every 2-4 mins! I cannot wait to get out of this hell hole in the morning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanMitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in room 306 for one night after been bumped from their sister hotel by Hyde Park, the rooms are not just small they are miniscule you cannot walk round the bed. The bathroom was so small that you had to almost back into the shower. The tv didn't work properly, there were light bulbs out. We were not even told breakfast was available, my advice don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not all that it seems”
Reviews.Author: treborBurnley
Reviews.Content: Booked it as we got a deal on line on the hotels website, when we arrived the guy on reception seem very surprised we had got the room at the price quoted, he then said it didnt include breakfast to which we said it does include breakfast, he apologised and confirmed it did. We asked for a quite room and was shown to an executive block which was further down the street. The room was unbelievably small, only one person could move around the bed as there was so little space, in the bathroom the complimentary toiletries were one container of body wash and a soap dispenser over the sink.The shower needs a bigger screen as water sprayed out over the toilet and saturated the floor.We asked for a quite room and was woken by the traffic at 5am in the morning passing outside, the noise of trains could be heard close by. The remote control was so dirty we had to place it in a clear plastic bag before we touched it. Two good things about the hotel; one was the breakfast which was taken in the Best Western across the road and secondly its location to the restaurants on Earls Court Rd, would recomend Wagamamas and Zizzi's

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Amanda P
Reviews.Content: Very easy walking distance from Earl court station and also accessible by Heathrow transfers for Â£15 one way. Having read some previous review after I booked I had low expectations. I was given a 5th floor room which did not vibrate annoyingly with the trains although there was some street noise as it was a front room. The elevator only went to the 3rd floor but a hotel staff member carried my bag up the other 2 floors. The A/C was set at 26 degrees and couldn't be adjusted which meant that I had to leave the window open permanently. There was a very dusty smell in the room so not recommended for asthmatics! The bathroom was compact but clean although the shower screen was only about 20 cm wide, so had the water pressure not been so apallingly low then ther would have been water all over the bathroom floor after each shower. The single bed had seen much better days with no mattress cover and distinct sweat stains on the mattress visible through the thin sheets. No bedbugs but was not game to sleep between the sheets. WiFi was only availably in the lobby area and very slow when it worked... which was a minority of the time. Hotel staff seemed very tired and bored most of the time. Took a long time to check in. Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on 23rd October 2011”
Reviews.Author: paulwilliamsWales
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, tidy and good value for money and well positioned for our needs just a short walk from Earls Court tube station for good access to the city. The rooms are small, but no problem for a short stay. Staff were friendly. no complaints at all and would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, affordable rooms, clean, but SMALL”
Reviews.Author: McHsieh
Reviews.Content: Very well located in London, clean and modern, but too small. I'm a petite Asian woman and found it difficult to move about! Had to turn my body sideways and wiggle about just to close the bathroom door. Was fine for us since we only stayed 1 night, but would recommend staying somewhere else if you have a longer stay (merely because of the lack of space). We requested a room facing the street (as far from the train tracks as possible) and were happily given that, thank you staff! Would definitely stay again, for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: bjorn b
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. The rooms are small but nice. My big reservation is bed bugs. I got about 50 bites after staying there for 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Staff tried, hotel was dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Barbara_Sydney056
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a long trip. We were first put in a room on the train line which we asked to be moved from because of the noise. We were then put in a room on the street side and the smell was terrible. The room was so small you could not got to the bathroom without tripping over a suitcase. Getting a suitcase opened was impossible. There was no mattress protector on the bed and everything seemed grimy. We thought we would leave the next morning and find something else, but when we heard another gentleman complaining about his room we asked if we could be moved to. This time downstairs to a slightly larger room, but still grimy and again, no mattress protector on the bed. I did not sleep between the sheets as I was so terrified of bed bugs. The bathroom was dangerously small, water everywhere, a slip hazard for someone not to steady on their legs. The hallway was so small you just about had to be an acrobat to get your suitcase through. Having said that, the staff was generally courteous and obliging. I could understand their demeanour after reading about all the complaints on trip advisor. It must be very demoralising.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and terrible rooms !!”
Reviews.Author: Alan C
Reviews.Content: I really liked the staff of this hotel, inspite of having terribly small and vibrating rooms they really try their best to make customers happy. I stayed in this hotel in September with my wife. Upon arrival we were given a room which was vibrating every five minutes because of nearby train station as we complained this to receptionist named Komal (she was very polite and patient), she informed us they didnt have any clean rooms but promised us to give another in half an hour. we got another room which was small but quite, as I observed there were so many customers complaining about the noise and size of the rooms but the lady at reception was trying to solve the problems at her best, she really deserve an appreciation. I would specially like to say thanks to Komal for making our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere but here”
Reviews.Author: damox
Reviews.Content: The room was so small that it is was hard to get around the foot of the bed. I thought it would be easier to walk across the bed, lost my balance and almost ended up going out through the window. The bed was so broken down and sagged so much it was like sleeping in a hammock. Camping in Kensington Park would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Judi G
Reviews.Content: I agree that this hotel has a major bed bug problem. I am now covered in bites which are driving me nuts! Can't believe the hotel is graded as a 3-star hotel. When we arrived at the hotel entering the reception was a bit scary. The carpets were very 'tired' looking. We used the lift once as it was a very shakey experience. The room was tiny but furnished okay. The balcony outside the french doors were littered with cigarette stubs, empty cigarette boxes, etc. TV worked but the screen was cracked and the picture constantly jumped. Bath shower was ok but could do with a bigger shower door as floor got very wet. However, sitting on the bed putting on my makeup I noticed a brown mark on one of the containers. On closer inspection I realised it was a bed bug. Pulling back the sheet I saw blood on my husband's side of the bed and the sheets was full of bedbug poo. I put the bedbug onto a tissue & complained to reception. Manager's reaction was "oh God" - good act considering other complaints that I've just read. Refunded us for the night & moved us to another hotel. All seemed okay at first but I've now broken out in itchy bites that are driving me nuts. Did see a bedbug on the bathroom at other hotel. Having to take precautions in emptying our suitcases now that we are home as we are not sure whether the bedbugs have infected our clothing after seeing that bedbug in the other hotel owned by the same group.

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled our room”
Reviews.Author: KSmithandJones
Reviews.Content: They cancelled our room, which had been paid for and booked months in advance, 4 days before we were due to arrive in London from Brisbane. They said they tried to ring, they did not. There was no reason for the cancellation provided. On their booking page it says there is no cancellation from the guests, but looks like they can do whatever they want.

Reviews.Title: “We got ripped!”
Reviews.Author: arh1967
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 4 star hotel in Hyde Park. When we arrived we were told there was a "leak" and they had tried to contact us (they did not). We were charged for the room and taxied to Kensington Town House where the room was ridiculously small. We couldn't even walk around the bed, and there was not a chair to sit in. We were interrupted by housekeeping and maintenance for unnecessary issues. We think we gott ripped and are going to notify our travel agent not to recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Eaten Alive”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a bug problem as mentioned in the previous review, I am very allergic after my stay here am covered in bites top to toe, in fact I've never had so many. Steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Very very BAD”
Reviews.Author: Sergey1963
Reviews.Content: 1) Window is not possible to open and conditioner is broken ( only as ventilator) 2) There are BIG blood-sicking BUGS in the room. It is awfully.

Reviews.Title: “We could not wait to check out”
Reviews.Author: SydneySunchaser
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for a deluxe room, which smelt so strongly of sewerage we had to ask to change rooms. They changed us to a standard room, with no offer of compensation. The internet did not work most of the time. The air-conditioning did not work. The hot-water stopped. The explanation: "it is broken." The reception staff had very poor English. The only friendly/ helpful staff were the maintenance people and the bell boy. Will not be back if you paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Small Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: asbedi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located, just steps from the Earls Court Tube Station (on the Earls Court Road side). As a result, it is right in the heart of Earl's Court and has a lot of pubs and restaurants nearby. Overall, the hotel was nice and the staff was helpful. However, I personally found the rooms to be on the smaller side. And (maybe it was my particular room), the trains going in and out of the tube were very audible.

Reviews.Title: “Cost vs Value is conmpletely off!Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: TravelteamUK
Reviews.Content: I had to book this hotel for a business trip. It was virtually one of the last places available in the area within budget. I paid Â£262 for one night with breakfast for a double room. We stayed in room 408 on the 4th floor. Hotel location is great, very close to Earl's court station. Good points: The service was friendly and a gentleman carried our luggage across the road from the main reception to the Kensington Town House (part of Best Western Shaftesbury). The room was clean as far as I could see. The bed was comfortable. The noise level from the road was minimal. There were tea and coffee making facilities. (Unable to comment on breakfast as we did not have time to try it out) Bad points: The room was tiny and hot (though we spotted an air con at the wall the next working which may or may not work) The double bed was virtually squeezed between the entrance to the bathroom and the opposite wall. The window rattled in the breeze The drain in the shower did not flow too well, must be blockage somewhere in the pipes. The hair dryer was not working properly and only blew cold air plus it was fastened to the drawer, however the cord was too short to stand up and blow my hair so I had to sit on a wonky chair which in turn was too low to see myself properly in the mirror (this would only be a problem for women I guess) While the bed was comfortable the cover consisted of a sad looking woolen blanket between two white sheets. That is not the standard of bedding expected for such a high price. Overall verdict: The overall standard was not what you would expect for Â£262 but it was sufficient for one night. Going forward however I would definitely not return to this hotel unless the price was a lot less! In the real world (ie outside London!) I would not pay any more than Â£80 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: TheCookeTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were put in one of the basement rooms which had no view, was very dark and rumbled whenever a tube pulled into Earls Court Tube Station. There was no visable staircase to the basement, meaning that you have to take the lifts whenever you want to get to your room. The room itself was adequate, but very small and basic. The bathroom, however, was far too small (under 2 sq metres), had a door which would not shut properly and was lacking amenities. All in all, the room was clean and the hotel is located in a rather nice part of London with a short walk to Earls Court Station. It is worth noting, however, that there are many other leading competitors surrounding the Kensington Townhouse which are just as cheep and do not allow you to hear from your room each time a train pulls into Earls Court Tube Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: lizKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and paid GBP99 per night. The rate was without breakfast. The corridor to the room was a joke. It was so narrow that it is almost impossible to walk through with a luggage. Was given a room on the fifth floor but lift service only up to the fourth. You have to take a flight of stairs to the room and with the many fire exit doors in between, you would be out of breath by the time you reach yr room. Room was another story..extremely small that is almost impossible to accommodate 2 persons. There was air-condition in the room but it worked like a heater instead. Its impossible to cool the room and we guessed the temperature has been set permanently. They pride themselves as a 3 star hotel but amenities in the bathroom was a shower and a 2 in 1 shampoo and bath gel?? To be fair, the towels were thick and in good condition. Staff are generally polite and helpful. Can't fault them for the condition of the hotel or rooms. If you're willing to cough slightly more, I suggest you stay at a better hotel. This hotel is totally not worth your hard earned money!! Stay elsewhere..

Reviews.Title: “This hotel runs a scam!”
Reviews.Author: Trowsers
Reviews.Content: I booked for 2 night at the Kensington Town House through Late Rooms, because it was within walking distance of Earl's Court exhibition centre. I arrived around 5.30pm, only to find that I was one of many people trying to check in to be told that "the hotel had a water leak" and would have to move us to another hotel as the rooms were uninhabitable. The manager insisted that we would be taken by taxi to a hotel near Paddington. A row soon developed in the reception area, with a lot of unhappy and cross guests, many of whom had travelled long distances and who specifically wanted to be close to Earl's Court. The "water leak" story seemed an unlikely tale and I remonstrated with the manager. He said I could cancel if I wanted, which I did on the spot - I wanted to be near Earl's Court and not at Paddington! I walked 50 yards down the road and got a room at an alternative hotel, who told me that the Kensington Town Hotel moved their guests to hotels all over London - apparently they own some seven or eight other hotels, by overbooking the Kensington Town House deliberately in order to fill their other hotels. The manager at the alternative hotel said that this was a daily practice. Don't be fooled!

Reviews.Title: “Kensington Townhouse Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serenity31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before moving on to my other hotel (Garden View Hotel:see review) to take advantage of a cheaper rate for that particular night. This hotel is close to the tube (Earls Court) and nearby shops and restaurants. Checked-in without incident. I was overall very pleased with my room and regret that I didn't book here for my whole trip. Although it was small, it was very modern looking with a large flat screen TV and nice bathroom. My only complaint was that it was a bit of a hassle to get to my room with luggage because in order to get to my room I had to take an elevator up one floor, down the hall to exit a door, go down some steps and climb up another staircase all to reach my room. That said I did have a bell boy assist me to my room upon check-in, but on check out I removed my luggage myself so I was a bit out of breath by the time I reached the lobby. I would suggest if you have mobility problems try to get a room nearer to the elevators that don't require climbing stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: mbbeth
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst Hotels I have ever stayed in. The service was awful, our room was on the third floor overlooking the undeground, so we had to endure the noise from the trains. Thier plumbing system is terrible, we could hear everytime someone used the bathroooms in the rooms above, the water running down the pipes. In the batthroom (which is tiny), had soap dispensers at the sink and shower, neither of them worked, even though we mentioned this to the front desk on numerous occasions. The TV only has six channels, the room is very compact. On the plus side, the Hotel appears to have gone through a renovation, so the rooms were very well decorated. But if you stay there, request a room that does not overlook the railway, and does not include the noise of their plumbing system. Most of the staff are pretty unhelpful too, but not much you can do about that.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Room but excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: gtc1000
Reviews.Content: We got a last minute deal here for a double room no breakfast for Â£59 and I must say some of the previous reviews made me so worried about the standard of accommodation that instead of meeting friends when we arrived in London, we went straight to the hotel to book in late afternoon instead of arriving after the opera at 11pm. We had a first floor room looking over the front of the hotel onto the street with a balcony. The room was extremely compact and you could only have one person in the bathroom at a time (unless one was in the bath!) but as we were going to be there only for sleeping that was fine. The room was newly refurbished to an excellent standard and immaculately clean. The staff on reception were pleasant. You could hear a very gentle train noise every so often but I am a light sleeper and was not disturbed by it nor did we find any street traffic (it was a sat night/sunday morning). It is fantastically close to Earls Court Tube (less than 2 mins walk) and I would recommend it as excellent value for money. We would stay again and have already recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute thieves!!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mc2806
Reviews.Content: I firstly want to say I didn't even get a chance to stay in this hotel so I can't comment on the rooms etc but please read below to see why anyone and everyone needs to avoid this hotel at all costs. My girlfriend and I arrived in London early in the morning after a long flight from Johannesburg. We went to the hotel to see if we could check in, but as it was early we were told we could leave our bags there and come back at 2pm and the room would be ready. Please note I had already paid for this room through Wotif so we were apparently guaranteed a room. We left our bags there and did some sightseeing around London and returned in the late afternoon. When we arrived back there was a different person on the front desk and he told us that we couldn't be accommodated as they had been fully booked out. As I has already pre booked through a booking website I found this hard to believe. They had given my room away to somebody else and refused to give me my money back. When I asked why they took our bags and said for us to check in after 2pm the man at the front desk said that we couldn't stay there. So they clearly lied and stole our money for the booking. He rang the girl who was on the front desk when we arrived in the morning but she changed her story and claimed we never had a booking even though I had documents to prove this. The man was also very aggressive to my girlfriend which I was very upset about. We were kicked out of the hotel into the darkness and cold without the money I had payed for the room. The man said I will never get it back. We will see about that!!!! I have reported this to Wotif and the police so they will get theirs! I also got talking to another hotel in the area and the manager said that they always do this to their customers and have had many issues so please please don't stay here! In summary DO NOT stay in this hotel! They are thieves!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DaveWestmeath
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights, had booked a single room but on arrival was upgraded to a standard double, which was a basement room. Room was modern, comfortable, plenty of heat and air condition. Large plasma tv, and a nice modern onsuite. I have stayed in many hotels in this area in the past, and payed similar prices and more, but this hotel rates as one of the better ones. Staff were friendly at all times

Reviews.Title: “disappointing because *almost* a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: historydoll
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the price was great, and my room, although incredibly small, was very luxurious and well-appointed. It's just that the service is *unbelievably* bad. First they entered someone else's credit card number for me, so they announced that the card hadn't gone through and there was a huge kerfuffle about that. The next night they gave my room to someone else. so this nice young couple walked right in at 11:15 p.m. while I was sound asleep. My electronic key stopped working twice in three days. And finally, I had room service one night and left the tray for the cleaner to take away the next day--which never happened. She moved it to the floor and apparently cleaned around it and left it there. It's also kind of noisy; things like toilets flushing and showers sound like they're right in the room with you, though I never heard any voices. Mostly they just need to get their act together, but until they do.....

Reviews.Title: “only stay for one night not worth staying for longer”
Reviews.Author: racheyjjLincs
Reviews.Content: We were transfered from a sister hotel. on arrival we were informed wede get a free breakfast which to be fair was very nice but across the road not at the actual hotel. little things spoilt the hotel, the shower floor was all chipped and therefore you couldnt tell if it was clean or not. the bathroom was incredibly small you couldnt stretch both your arms out in it. the shower not only leaked but was tiny! the bathroom door didnt shut properly. the room itself was very small. they left us 1 spoon and 1 biscuit which we shouldnt moan about but we were starving by the time wede got there. the tv only had 4 channels and not the 1,2,3,4 normal ones very strange chanel choices. for the money we paid for 1 night it was fine for a budget hotel but i wouldnt stay for longer then 1 night. the tube went past every few mins and was quite noisey. its in a very good location for the tube on the plus side and every easy to get to all the tourist attractions. some of the staff were lovely and very helpful and others were quite rude. the manager basically told me to get stuffed when i asked for a room with a bath. the room was very modern and nicely furnished.a very mixed bag of emotions for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Hoojar
Reviews.Content: Typing this as I lie in my bed at the hotel. Checked into my tiny, but nice and clean room only to leave 1 minute later as the room overlooked the tube line and the noise was horrendous. So was moved to the front of the hotel which was just as bad. This is busy noisy central London and there is no double glazing, you hear everything. You can't sleep at this place because of the noise. Yes it's cheap, but if you don't sleep what's the point!

Reviews.Title: “For short stays only.....”
Reviews.Author: lonbusigirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel three times over a month long period, the first for three nights, the second for a week and the third for a six days. Each experience was different but in the end the same issues came to light. While this hotel is perfectly fine for a couple of nights after a while certain elements became problematic. The hotel is situated directly above an underground tunnel therefore no matter which floor you are on, the frequent noise of the subway is an issue, especially for those with jet lag. The customer service is lacking in terms of the front desk, the porters are excellent but the general front of house staff have no idea of the concept of privacy - and openly discuss private guest matters with a complete disregard for customers. The internet access is sporadic - despite being advertised as free in room and the phones don't work. I had to move room 4 times in order for them to work out that the fault was the network rather than the room and the staff were annoyed at the fact I had the gall to complain (despite the fact I was there on business and needed net access). The bed sheets were not changed on a whole 7 night period, the rooms could do with a deep clean, the carpets are dirty and on the whole could be better. The breakfast is not served in house rather you have to go across the street to another hotel to sample it. The rooms are very small, do not believe that you are booking into a 'superior' or 'deluxe' room as this is just nonsense. The hot water didn't work on average of two days per week. One other very important thing to note is the fact is that the Townhouse often overbook or lose bookings and have to find alternative arrangements for their clients. This is not a good thing to have to face when you've just gotten off a flight. The car service is also at an extreme premium and costs in excess of 50 % what a normal taxi would (they are easy to flag down at the end of the street). In general this hotel has good transport links (is two mins walk from Earl's Court) but its lack of customer service, the lack of net access, its inability to clean its rooms to a sufficient standard and the noise of the subway are it's major downpoints. Its sister hotel across the street which is also on Hogarth Road is marginally better but more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of problems but we did pay a heavily reduced price, so shouldn't complain.”
Reviews.Author: J_C_2323
Reviews.Content: I booked the room under the impression it was a Â£275 double room reduced to Â£55 and I thought 'This must be too good to be true'... Well, it was! There were several niggling problems that- when you add them up- led to a rather unsatisfactory stay, although I am still very pleased with the price I payed. Problem 1: Room was definitely not worth Â£275 per night (so good job we didn't pay that!) It was quite a big room for London, however the bed was very short (my feet reached the end and I'm 5'8"!). The en-suite was so tiny you could not sit on the toilet as the sink was right in front of you (I'm not exaggerating, I literally has to sit on it sideways!). Problem 2: The electrics. No WiFi (all room's are advertised with WiFi), Television kept randomly changing channel as if some one else was controlling it! Air-con did not work at all and the room was so hot we needed some! Which leads me on to..... Problem 3: When we tried to open the window to let cool air in (couldn't turn radiator off and it was on full blast the whole time), there were work men right outside (like 1 foot away from our window, who we'd already heard talking for a few hours before hand) doing some drainage to the water system, giving off an awful rotten smell. This went on from around 7am till after we checked out! The smell got in to our room as well. Problem 4: Our room was in the basement and every 2 minutes on the dot the room vibrated as the tube went past! It couldn't be ignored, they were significant vibrations and quite a loud sound. I thought it would stop by 12.40am (when tube finishes for night) but it seemed to continue all night! It really disturbed my sleep. Problem 5: No hot water in shower (possibly related to what the workers were fixing) so we had to go to a different hotel and use that shower. Apparently this problem affected all the rooms in the hotel. Problem 6: Thinnest walls I've ever experienced in a hotel. I don't want to think I'm being unfair to this hotel but I thought it only fair to those considering the 'amazing' deal to know that the room they will most likely give you will be in the basement and will not be up to the rest of the hotels standards and you will be kept awake by the tube. I think all the other problems were just due to us being unlucky really. Positives: Everything else said, it was still a decent room; There were good tea making facilities; Iron and board; TV; mirrors; REALLY good breakfast (served in the Shaftsbury hotel over the road- which looked like a really nice hotel); nice pleasant staff; very close to Earls Court tube station; clean; midday checkout (always nice to get that extra hour!). I'd even stay here again, so long as I was guaranteed not to stay in basement! I'm sure if you pay the full price your room would be much, much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!”
Reviews.Author: MidgetGem1980
Reviews.Content: We did not actually book this hotel, we were sent to it from its sister hotel, The Hyde Park Premier, when it supposedly had maintenance problems. This is the worst hotel room I have ever stayed in. It was the size of a shoe box with a bathroom the size of a match box, and that is not even an exaggeration. It had a double mattress on a single bedbase so the mattress overhang and was uncomfortable. The shower was cold, had no pressure, and the water collected in the shower tray. There was no shampoo, in fact the soap dispenser was in the shower and the body wash dispenser by the sink - very odd. All through the night you could hear noise from the pipes. I would never stay at this hotel again, nor with the Shaftesbury chain of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Businesstraveller089
Reviews.Content: I am generally not a complainer, but in this case... Despite the photos and description, a superior single room is very small and has one single bed (80cm wide) - I could barely stand up straight in this room. I had to pay GBP 25 extra for a double room (total GBP 125). The shower was cold in the morning, the fire alarm went off twice in the early morning due to shower steam (in a hotel!). The iron did not work and there was no internet even though this was part of the service. The noisy tube is riding right under the hotel. And finally: there was a blood stain on my sheets. Personnel is completely oblivious and smile everything away. All in all, very dissapointing and concerning actually....!

Reviews.Title: “Gresat Location clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chadsta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in for 2 nights when we first arrived in London. Initially we went to Best Western across the road, and they recommended this as this was about 20 Pounds cheaper and is their sister hotel. The hallways are narrow, and lift is very tiny. But that is expected in this sort of building. The rooms are clean and breakfast was included. Breakfast was served at Best western across the road, and it was a pretty good breakfast. Overall no complaints, and for what you pay, and the location it is definitely great value. Also they have free internet (wired) in the room, and also free internet PC in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Sour service and sinks”
Reviews.Author: ZanyB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many of the three stars around Earls Court - most are accpetable - this one was not. Staff at reception were unwelcoming and unhelpful when we arrived only some 30 minutes before normal check in time, room we were given was small and dark and above the tube line so very noisy. We had to reconnect the telly ourselves, the wardrobe is only 9 inches deep - and 6 of those are occupied by an ironing board and as we discovered on return to the room very late at night the drains are blocked and the bathroom though spotless stank - no offer of a price reduction when we pointed out any of these faults .

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad and i've stayed in some dives over the years.”
Reviews.Author: Conorooney
Reviews.Content: In the hotel as I write this. I've stayed in some of the most plush locations but also some of the most horrid ofhotels and this stay in making it fall into the latter category. As a surveyor and designer I admire buildings of this nature so I understand the feaures that go with this type of building i.e. small rooms, narrow hallways. I understand why the lift doesn't go to the top floor, our floor, because the lift controls are on our floor. That aside, having paid Â£200 for two nights (a lot of money for it as some of the most modern hotels cost in and around the same) I expect hot water to say the least. The shower was awful and it is what I look forward to the most when I go to a hotel after travelling. I love the pressure you get in them to totally revive you after long train, plane and car rides. I had to run around the shower to get wet. A sneeze has more pressure. I had to boil the kettle to have a wet shave as the water wasn't hot enough. Room size: Tiny. I don't mind this however but the rooms are the smallest i've stay in. Staff: Very friendly. I phoned about the hot water and pressure and they said they'd look into it. Fingers crossed I can have a hot shower tomorrow! They all say hello when leaving and entering. Bathroom: Tiny(er)! I actually clipped my forehead on the toilet roll holder when usingt he toilet. As I said, I love these types of buildings and I know small rooms go hand in hand with these. (well actually, these houses were gutted and converted so they could have made the rooms bigger but the original owners wanted to squeeze as many rooms into it as possible for more revenue) but it wasn't these owners. Location: Excellent! Right beside plenty of restaurants (go to Wagamamas) and the Underground! Services: Some lights didn't work in the room, the window kept banging at night and we were on the good side of the hotel (it's 50/50 as to whether you'll get the train side and be up all night)! Free broadband.

Reviews.Title: “nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: klaklitika
Reviews.Content: Nice, but noisy (the railway is just below the windows) clean rooms, great location (the tube is just around the corner) No fridge in the room I reccomend it for a short stay

Reviews.Title: “Rennovated, friends staff. However, rooms to rear noisy”
Reviews.Author: Patrick084
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clearly been rennovated since many of the reviews on trip advisor were written. The rooms (or at least those I saw) are modern, well furnished with 3 to 4 star facilties. However, the rooms to the rear do suffer from tube train noise and I asked to be moved, which was possible on one night but not the other as the hotel was full. The rooms are pretty small, but ok for the price in London. One has to cross the street for breakfast as this it at the sister hotel, which isn't ideal. However, the breakfast was pretty good. The staff are friendly. Overall, the hotel feels a cut price option to a 4 star, however if you are paying less than not a bad choice for tourists etc as the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Steamy noisy room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Akl79
Reviews.Content: The things I like are the location. Shops, restaurant, tube sta and supermarket etc. The room is clean and well-maintained, however very hot, tiny and noisy. Very handy to tube station though. People walk around on stairways and corridor that very disturb. No openable windows. Free internet connection with disconnection so often. It might be hard to find nice hotels with reasonable price in London. But I would not be back to this hotel and keep looking others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, close to tube”
Reviews.Author: rugged7
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's small (as are all hotel rooms in Europe). But it was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rate was reasonable by London's standard. If you are put in the back, you will hear train noise. I was lucky not to be. Location is ideal: close to tube, restaurants and pubs. A friend I was with said this was one of the best rooms she has had in London for the price and she has stayed at many.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the other reviews make out it to be”
Reviews.Author: Becm1986
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute so didn't have time to read tripadvisor reviews till after booking. I was really worried due to the reviews but was pleasantly suprised. It has a really good feel about it and the staff are friendly. Yeah the room was small but it was bigger than the room i had at the Rydges in Kensington. It was also decorated nicer than the Rydges. It's an old london building so of course the rooms are not going to be huge. The recent renovation is great, very modern room with flatscreen tv and aircon. Free Internet is a bonus to. If you have your own computer it's not wifi but they supply cables so you can plug into wall socket in your room. If not the reception has a computer. Location very central and only short walk to earls court station, postoffice, laundromat and takeaways. Speaking of Earls Court train station, i could hear the trains from my room on level one but it did not affect my sleep. This hotel is definately for the easy going traveller, not for the fussy. I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Find another spot”
Reviews.Author: ChrisO67
Reviews.Content: Admittedly a last minute booking, but the photos made the hotel rooms look nice. The front counter staff were pleasant. The hotel is in a good location - 100m from Earls Court tube station. The room is clean and kept presentable. BUT... The room had 30 - 45cm around the bed, not even enough space to put a bag on the floor or comfortably walk around the bed. The closet couldn't possibly hang any clothes in it as it is less than 30cm deep. The ensuite, while kept clean each day, was very small with a 60cm square shower cubicle. Excellent shower water pressure though. The bed was very uncomfortable. Our ground floor room did have some noise from the tube trains, but not enough to keep you awake. Stay here is space is not an issue... unfortunately it is for me.

Reviews.Title: “Dungeon like room in the dank basement”
Reviews.Author: Ace66
Reviews.Content: This hotel poses a conundrum - location wise it is good - the tube is 2 minutes away and there are a number of bars/pubs within striking distance. However, in terms of accommodation this hotel is poor. Our room was so small there wasn't room to swing a cat and as we were put down in the basement it was also dark and dingy. Room service made a racket in the morning so that you couldn't sleep beyond 6am, the tube rumbled by underground every five minutes as well and for reasons unexplained a buzzing noise could be heard every ten minutes through the night - all of the above added up to a disappointing and frustrating stay at the town house. If you're a little desperate and need any old place to stay for a night or two this will suffice - just...

Reviews.Title: “SO BAD IT WAS ALMOST FUNNY”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSteve38
Reviews.Content: I was transferred to the Kensington Townhouse from another Shaftesbury Hotels property. The official story was maintenance issues, but from the number of Shaftesbury Hotels customers being shuttled around London that morning I suspected overbooking. The staff at the Kensington Tonwhouse were welcoming and tried to be as helpful as they could. Real effort had gone into decorating my "executive single" in a style very different from other, dowdier London hotels and providing a pleasant, modern bathroom. But so many things were seriously bad. The room, entered off a fire escape stairway, was tiny. The ceiling was low; I wondered if the height was legal. Two of the room lights had failed. The bed mattress was lumpy. The curtains across the tiny window couldn't be closed. The tiny window didn't close properly either, and District Line trains passed every few minutes. The cupboard door didn't close, and neither did the door to the bathroom. The chair was falling apart. The air conditioner blew hot or chilly (but was noisy enough to mask some of the train noise). The water in the bathroom was lukewarm at best and the pressure was low. And the glass shower screen was "off its tracks" and almost fell into the shower recess when re-opened after a shower. That was dangerous. I was only staying a night, so there was no point in making a fuss. And the location, minutes away from Earls Court Station, was quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - handy to Earl's Court Tube Station”
Reviews.Author: the_other_other_guy
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for a small room but it is good enough to put your head down and it is extremely close to the tube (Earl's Court) so you can get anywhere relatively fast. The breakfast is in another building (the Best Western across the street) but it is a good breakfast. Not much else to say about the place, so if you're just looking to get a place to put your head down and be close to 'stuff', then this is the place - the price is a little high, but it is London.

Reviews.Title: “what a total dump”
Reviews.Author: kyters
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise and boy was it a surprise put in the dungeon with the mould and peeling wallpaper and filthy curtains oh and the stink , mind you the bathroom is so small you can clean your teeth while sitting on the toilet.Furniture stacked in corridors must be a hazzard thank god there wasn't a fire. Don't stay here i've seen better doss houses.It's a total dump dont bother complaining you will get more sense talking to my two year grandson

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping in the Subway”
Reviews.Author: busy65
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel, even if its free, there are three very nice ones across the street, if you get the breakfast (which is actually really good) you eat at the sister hotel anyway. We stayed there the next time we came it was much better, Best Western Premier Shaftesbury London Kensington is what its called, book through best western for the best price!! The rooms were tiny, we literally didnt have room for our luggage on the floor, the shower didnt work, the TV was broken, The glass was missing from the window, an the subway shook the foundation of the building every 3 minutes until midnight, then started again at five. Absolutely aweful...

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Rooms I've Ever Seen!”
Reviews.Author: cirulac
Reviews.Content: The room we had (204) was easily the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in. There wasn't even enough room to open our suitcase! And the bathroom, room for one -- barely. The window didn't open, so the air was stale. Strangely, we slept very well! (Lack of oxygen?) On the plus side, it was clean and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: JHA1952
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in this hotel as we had recently stayed in the sister hotel across the street. Every part of the Kensington Townhouse from the reception, staircase and lift to the rooms was very cramped and claustrophobic. The 'Superior' double room we had at the was not what we expected at all. OK, it had the TV, teamaker, ironing board etc but the room was so small, we could hardly both be in the room at the same time! The bathroom was no better - when the door was opened it hit the edge of the bed and inside the bathroom was so tiny that you couldn't even dry yourself when you stepped out of the bath. The shower screen was so narrow that it didn't stop the water from going all over the floor but if it was any wider, you wouldn't be able to squeeze past to get in the bath in the first place. Our room backed on to the railway so there were trains rumbling past every couple of minutes. The sound-proofing was very poor as we could hear other people's toilets flushing which wakened me during the night. The only good side was the location - Hogarth Road is very handy for Earl's Court tube station and there are lots of nice little restaurants nearby. Our advice would be to stick to the sister hotel, the Best Western Shaftsbury just across the street where we had to go for breakfast anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ureliable”
Reviews.Author: Fortalezakaj
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for one night - the hotel did not honor the reservation with the result that they sent me to another hotel called Berjaya Eden Park a terrible hotel with stinking dirty rooms. I cannot recommend a hotel that acts like this when a client has a guaranteed reservation. I cannot in this review say anything about the rooms, or the facilities - this is a note to take care if you try to book this hotel online - they will not honor your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, however, lacks attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: CMEdinburghScotland
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights back in May with my partner. After searching through lots of other websites we were attracted by the affordability of this Hotel in particular. The Hotel is conveniently situated 2 Minutes walk from Earls Court Tube Station, however, on arrival we were not made aware of check out times or of any other services, room service, etc. The room was small and as a Chambermaid myself, it could have been dusted more thoroughly/hoovered daily (although, the shower room was very clean). This Hotel would be suited to those who don't expect a particularly high level of service (which I suppose you have to expect from the price) or for those of you who don't want to spend much time in the Hotel. On our last night we were pleased to find a beautiful Italian Restaurant (Strada) only 5 minutes away. Overall, the staff could be a little friendlier but we both enjoyed our stay. This Hotel is not for those looking for a quiet get-away -It is London after all! Some noise should be expected from the Tubes passing by regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maspc
Reviews.Content: Best inexpensive hotel we have stayed at in London. The staff was the most helpful we have ever dealt with--going out of their way to help us with our endless luggage-and then offering us an extra 4 hours stay until check out. Room was spotless, relatively large. Bathroom was large, appeared to have all new fixtures. Bed was firm. Best breakfast we have had outside of one in Venice. Minor caveats. Lights by bed worked at first, then stopped working. Shower had little pressure, but these were minor things, All in all, a fine place to stay and we will return here.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money-book the best western across the road”
Reviews.Author: citychick87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Best Western Shaftesbury Kensington across the road from the hotel and knew it was the sister hotel of the Kensington Townhouse. We loves the BW hotel and on our return to london deided to try out the Townhouse as it looked very nice on the website. It doesnt live up to expectations. Staff are not as pleasant and gave very very minimal interaction during check-in. We were given a room on the 1st floor which was next to the lift. The smell in the corridor outsde our room was terrible and stayed that way throughout our stay. The room was much smallerthan that of the BW and the shower was hand held (not advertised on the website as so). The complimentary toiletries were really cheap and actually smelled like vomit. Nothing like that on offer in BW. Parts of the wooden panels on one of the cupboards was missing. The TV had much fewer channels than that of the BW. Our room was next to the lift and the noise levels were terrible with people passing by. Our DO NOT DISTURB sign was ignored when we were asleep and a member of staff chapped our room door several times just to offer us a fruit basket when we had one in the room.The carpet was noticeably stained and dirty. It is not worth the money. You attend for breakfast in the BW across the road too. I would recommend booking the BW instead as it isnt much more expensive ifyou book through the shaftesbury hotels website.

Reviews.Title: “don't ever stay here,even if desperate”
Reviews.Author: Niminni
Reviews.Content: we've been here for an hour and we're not impressed. We've been shoved in the basement after being ignored at the check in desk and had to find our room without instruction. We haven't got a clue when check out time is and the constant rumbling from the tube line and the lack of natural light combined with a view of a derelict upside down toilet door is thoroughly depressing. The bathroom is set out in such a way that going to the toilet has to a sidewards seated affair and if you choose to use the shower, breathe in, try not to fall into the sink and remain upright for the duration. Go to the Henley Gardens instead-smaller rooms but friendly staff, no noise, better layout and distinct lack of damp and peeling wallpaper.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: AnneExeter
Reviews.Content: Room was uncomfortably hot and stuffy. Air-conditioning sounded like a jet engine. Room overlooked train line. Trains ran every few minutes from 5:30 am to midnight. Very noisy! Shower only luke warm. TV didn't work properly. Room very cramped. Would absolutely not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel with issues”
Reviews.Author: theatremamma
Reviews.Content: The Good: Nicely decorated with good location. Easy walk to underground. Lots of restaurants nearby and shops. Staff pleasant. Good price. The Bad: Rooms are very small, which is not unexpected given the price. Insist on a room at the front of the hotel or you will feel as if you are sleeping on railroad tracks. Really. The trains run directly behind the hotel and you can hear every one of them. Rooms are a bit run down. The window would not close in my first room and the second had a ceiling leak. Water pressure in shower non-existent and hot water scarce.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated rooms but housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: lindseyb83
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in March 2010 Upon arriving we had been upgraded to a 4 star room in a seperate building around the corner. The room was lovely, but the bed had a sheet, a thin blanket then a thin throw over the top. In the entire 4 days the bedding was changed only once and the carpet was not hoovered at all despite the housekeeper having been to the room to 'clean' . After 2 nights we decided to call reception when we had returned to our room on day 3 after a day out to find that the previous two night's bedding was still on the bed The gentleman on reception explained that bedding was changed every two days not daily at the hotel (unnaceptable in the 1st place however even if this is the case then we were on the 3rd day with no fresh bedding). I explained that I would like fresh bedding on the bed that night we were offered a room change, to which I declined due to the inconvenience of packing and unpacking again half way into the stay. In the end I had to say to the gentleman that if he sorted us out with some drinks in the bar we could make ourselves scarce while a housekeeper came back to the room. After 20 minutes in the bar the gentleman returned to say our room was ready so we returned after a long day out for a nice evening in with some take away that we'd picked up on the way back, only the pull back the bedding and find that the only difference was fresh pillow cases!!!!!! This completley topped it for me, and back onto reception I went and the housekeeper returned a 3rd time to make the bed whilst we were in the room, totally unapologetic and downright room!! I would not reccomend this hotel to anybody, it looks really nice on the outside but scratch the surface and the service is appalling and there are cracks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy digs in great location”
Reviews.Author: Timothy275
Reviews.Content: I read several negative reviews after I returned from my trip, and I was surprised because I found this hotel to be rather charming and cozy. One quibble -- I thought it had WiFi in the room, but it was only a wired internet connection. Also, the price for breakfast was really expensive, so I just made tea in my room each morning. The room itself was a bit small, but I've come to expect that in budget European hotels, and since I was traveling solo, it wasn't a big deal. The bathroom was newly renovated and very comfortable. The location was excellent -- just down the street from the Earl's Court tube station. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: YasmineYap
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 3 days and was excellent. We were given a bigger room as requested as I am pregnant and due to the location the noise from the tube is disturbing at first but if windows are close, you can barely hear the noise. Breakfast is at a sister hotel infront less than 1 minute walk and is perfect. What else do you want with great location and the best value for money accomodation? Will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NellieCheshire
Reviews.Content: Dont ever stay at this hotel the staff were unpleasant and unwilling to help. We had a special offer rate and when we checked in they tried to make us pay the full rate even though we had the confirmation with us. The bedroom was tiny, no remote for the tele and you had to go to another hotel to eat your breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value both clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MikeHRotherham
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome with courteous staff. Very clean bedroom, bedding excellent and bathroom spotless.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SHOCKING DUMP DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!! EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hazelnut10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a shockingly TERRIBLE DUMP!!! DO NOT STAY THERE!! We had a phone call about a week before our trip to London and were told due to "water damage" we were being transferred to the "Jury Inn" in Chelsea, which was an absolute delight! Then after our first night we arrived back to the hotel and were informed the transfer was only for the first night and we were being "booted out" of "The Jury Inn" and transferred to the "Kensington Townhouse". We went ballistic as were under the impression our 3 night stay was for the whole duration in the "Jury Inn", obviously not!!! They "forgot" to tell us it was only for one night so we were told to pack up, get out of our room and get a taxi to the "Townhouse".. I couldn't believe it!! I have never been treated this way in 25 years of travelling. Our tiny room at the "Townhouse" was only the size of the actual double bed itself with no space to move about and we felt totally claustrophic. So claustrophic in fact that we had to get out and go and have a few drinks, and then dinner. Its a truly miserable place! The noise levels were intense from the traffic outside and we hardly slept a wink. There is NO double glazing?? It was my birthday and I complained in the lobby to the manager and things got VERY heated and I lost my temper with him bigtime. We finally got compensation in that we were moved over the road to a 4 star hotel and he gave us the best room in that other hotel but the damage was already done, although it pays to complain in that he finally charged us only 2 nights for the price of 3, and of course got the upgrade and free breakfasts. However DO NOT run the risk of staying in this tiny tiny hotel unless you don't mind being shut in a "broom closet" sized room!! You have been warned, your room will be TINY and you won't have any room to move about. We were actually climbing all over the bed like idiots just to get from one side of the room to the other and kept "falling out" with each other as it was so cramped and suffocating. Thank God the manager moved us to the hotel across the road otherwise we would have come home.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money staying at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: meg99hotlon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a 3 night leisure break and I thought that it would be a special hotel as the price was quite expensive and the web pictures made the rooms out to be lovely. It said a "Superior Single" room!. I am from London so I know London well and I knew the area. On arrival I had to give my credit cards details to the receptionist before I saw the room and a Â£30.00 cash deposit (nothin statted on the web site about this) in case I damaged something. Once this was done I was taken to a room so small that my own toilet/bathroom is bigger. At the end of the bed I pulled back the curtains to find the tube line at the back of the hotel room, so much for good first impressions. I complained and to be fair I was moved out of the hotel to one of the three in the hotels range in the area. The "Exectuve" room. This was better but had limited facilities.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS & OVER-BOOKING”
Reviews.Author: Seebees
Reviews.Content: We have suffered two incidents of bed bugs in different rooms at this hotel. It is also a shame this hotel (indeed, the group chain) adopts a practice of over-booking to such an extent, as their rooms, service and general value seem fair - on the face of it. At this hotel, we have specifically witnessed over-booking on several occasions, the most recent occasion being this week. We have stayed at several of the Shaftesbury hotels over a period of a year (in excess of 40 nights), and have witnessed weary travellers arriving only to be greeted with the stale-faced rejection of "Sorry, there's no room at the inn"! Shaftesbury could write a "Book of Excuses", but these range from : - Are you sure it's this hotel; or - We've mislaid your booking; to - There's a maintenance problem with your room. Mostly the excuses seem plausible in isolation, and it seems valiant that they arrange a taxi to take you to another hotel. However, when these excuses have been heard so often, and guests then endure the poor service when transferred to another hotel, it's easy to understand the frustration expressed by earlier reviewers is under-stated. We have specifically suffered being moved to areas we didn't want to be in, the rooms were rarely as described (even if the aircon was working), no meaningful apology or compensation was ever offered, and if we wanted to negotiate any modification relating to our tariff we would have to contact the original hotel that couldn't accommodate us. In all, regrettably, a hotel chain that offers promise, but regularly lets people down in terms of environmental health and service reliability.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mailthecook
Reviews.Content: We had booked a superior double room which was situated on the 2nd floor facing the street. The room itself was small but big enough. It's what you expect for a double room in London, especially at a rate of Â£70 per night. Compared to Paris hotel rooms this would be considered spacious. The decor was very nice, the room was clean and the bathroom quite nice. Our booking included breakfast which had a full English to offer as well as some fresh fruit and a good selection of breads. The food was good quality. Staff was very friendly and polite, I did not have any problems and even overheard a different guest commenting on how "every member of staff has been exceptionally good" during check-out. You will be asked to pay in advance which I do not mind as it means I can safe time during check-out. For some reason the hotel itself was overheated. In the room we kept the window open at all times and turned off every radiator and air conditioning that we could find so it cooled down in there. But the hallways were still unusually warm. That is something I have encountered in every London hotel I have ever been to, so maybe it's a general practice? Since we stayed here in December it didn't really provide any problems except that you were usually underdressed when leaving the room. And grateful for freezing fresh air outside. All in all a great hotel that I will definitely come back to.

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BrandyWestSussex
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such an awful hotel. The staff were rude, and showed no concern for any of the issues we encountered. We booked a Superior Double room - the best available. What a joke! The room itself can't have been any larger than a double bed! We had to access our room through a smaller than average sized door, which could not fully open as the bed in the room restricted it, which - once me managed to struggle in - was a surprise due to the fact the bed was only an oversized single! We had the pleasure of sharing our room with what I can only assume was the buildings boiler. But best of all, was the noise that came in from the thin paned window - trains! These were running constantly throughout the night, ensuring that we had as little sleep as possible. At times when we left our room, we could not get back in upon our return as our room key kept being dissabled. The bar was extremely insufficient. When we required a drink, they had no change, no coffee, and minimal staff. Overall this is a very badly run, badly kept hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Frithsontour
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and my daughter and her fiance stayed here for 2 nights the rooms are described as superior double rooms. The are tiny rooms and the bed is the size of a large single. There is nothing superior about the hotel. The rooms at the back of the hotel are above a railway track it is incredible noisy all night long. It can only be described as staying in a signal box all night. The staff are rude and surly. Please do not stay at this hotel, if you have already booked. Cancel it.

Reviews.Title: “worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: ilovegelato
Reviews.Content: Upon entering this hotel, we expected it to be very nice and relaxing. Boy were we wrong. The room was incredibly small and you had to jump onto the bed to get to the other side of the room because there was no room between the foot of the bed and the desk. The hotel staff did not speak english fluently and were not helpful at at all. The bellboy was very sweaty and creepy. Our room was not even made up everyday. The air conditioning made a very loud booming noise every 15 minutes and the staff jeep saying it was going to be fixed but it never was and it woke us up all through the night. I was apalled byt the service at this hotel. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good clean cheap hotel , no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Fatthinslim
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to london 16th to 17th june and stayed at the kensington town hotel, got to london and it was very easy to get to , just headed for Earls court tube and it is 50yrds away. and only a 15min walk from the science museum and natural history museum also. the room was clean , bed was comfortable and was air conditioned. free tea coffee etc in room, for london especially kensington this was a real bargain. check out lastminute.com for offers as we stayed there with london eye and river cruise included in the overnight stay for Â£125 , happy days.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is on top of a train tunnel”
Reviews.Author: tickyou
Reviews.Content: there's about a train every 30 sec passing in the tunnel right below the hotel and making the whole room shake like crazy. you can't even hear the sound of the TV when a train/metro runs under. if you are offered one of the lower ground level rooms, run away, you won't be able to sleep quietly, except between 1AM and 5AM when the trains are not working...

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a place to crash for a night, in the centre of Earls Court”
Reviews.Author: JayJaySouthend
Reviews.Content: Good location yet fairly quiet (on a side road so traffic isn't a problem). Rooms are very small, so, you wouldn't want to stay here for long. I read the reviews about the tube so I asked for a high floor, so, this wasn't a problem. Its really difficult to contact the hotel & spent hours the night before trying to confirm my booking as received no confirmation from the booking agency. Ideal if the location works for you & you literally want a place to crash - its a tight squeeze for 2 people!

Reviews.Title: “Room 405 memories”
Reviews.Author: johnk586
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel earlier than the 2pm check in time to be greeted by a guest at the check in asking to be moved to another room. Odd we thought. We were allocated room 405 on the 4th floor. Lift access was a bit tight from the adjacent corridor and this must rate as one of the worlds slowest lifts. Our first impression of Room 405, Small and hot. There was just enough room at the window side of the bed to squeeze my size 9 shoes into to open the window as the heating controls seemed not to work. The opposite side of the bed was the door to the en suite. The door opened only 12" as it came to a stop against the bed. Anyone over a 36" waist size can rule this room out. Switched on the telly and laid on the bed. The telly picture rolled every few seconds, I reported this to reception who sent someone up but were unable to sort it. Nice pattern of water marks on the ceiling from the room above. Managed to squeeze into the bathroom for a shower which throws water everywhere. I suspect there are water marks on the ceiling below room 405. Went out to a show and came back 23.15 ish. Window still open as room still hot. No milk for a cuppa. Rang reception and asked for some more. Didnt arrive. Listened to the couple in the room above. Wonder what they were doing with a masonary drill?
